reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC UK MINISTER LOOKS TO

text.title: UK MINISTER LOOKS TO EASE TENSION ON TOKYO TRIP
text.author: By Sten Stovall Reuters
text.body: The U K Government hopes breakthrough on deadlock Japan over trade policies during next week s visit to Tokyo by Corporate Affairs Minister Michael Howard political sources Howard who leaves Japan tomorrow told Reuters he try to promote understanding on trade issues during his visit Meanwhile Britain re examine letter Japanese Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone promising personal help solving row over U K Firm s bid to win significant role Japan s telecommunications market government sources Tensions risen following Britain s decision to arm itself early new statutory powers says could be used against certain Japanese financial institutions Britain reacted optimistically at first to letter Nakasone to Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher seeing as signal he work towards ensuring satisfactory outcome to bid launched by Cable Wireless Plc CAWL L government officials But view since been clouded by reports Tokyo Nakasone s assurances really constituted little more than politeness face British anger they added Howard he use his trip to push bigger role Japan s telecommunications industry Cable Wireless Plc U K Government made issue test case Japan s willingness to open markets adequately to outside competition Asked whether letter Nakasone rejection attempts by Britain to achieve Howard I am sure correct to regard Mr Nakasone s letter as rejection Mrs Thatcher s request him says he taking personal interest problem I don t understand to be closed at all Howard added during his Tokyo visit he be talking to them the letter finding out exactly what they do mean making plain we take very serious view fact access to Japanese markets as free as we allow access to our markets to be He noted under new Financial Services Act Britain could revoke or deny licences to Japanese banking insurance institutions London if U K Firms fail to receive similar treatment financial markets Japan soon I hope won t come to I don t think Howard added During trip Howard meet officials Tokyo Stock Exchange Ministry Finance Trade Ministry Posts Telecommunications Minister Shunjiro Karasawa Karasawa regarded as behind opposition to any significant role Cable Wireless Japanese telecommunications industry Share prices on London Stock Exchange were undermined again today by fears possible U K Japanese trade war despite denials by Trade Industry Secretary Paul Channon Britain on verge trade war He told meeting insurance brokers today Britain believed sensible solution could be found open Japanese markets to British goods Government officials were at pains today to deny Britain set deadline three weeks Japan to promise similar access to financial markets to U K based financial firms as enjoyed London by equivalent Japanese firms They Department Trade Industry officials yesterday measures against Japanese financial institutions could be imposed then but did necessarily constitute deadline Experts believe Britain lose out by acting against Japanese banks insurance investment institutions But despite danger Japanese firms taking their trade elsewhere Europe Howard he did expect move to backfire He radio interview today it true we benefit their presence but they want to lose those advantages I am sure they making their views plain to Japanese government on matter Howard who also be visiting South Korea before returning to London on April his trip to Tokyo planned well before current trade row Howard his talks Japanese officials also include ways jointly combating financial fraud global markets Japanese officials be done through cooperation between national regulatory bodies He memorandum understanding exchanging information to combat financial fraud be sought Japan on terms similar to one signed autumn between Britain United States

reuters.unknown: F RM A f reute u f BC CONABLE WARNS PROTECT

text.title: CONABLE WARNS PROTECTIONISM MIGHT SPREAD
text.author: By Alver Carlson Reuters
text.body: World Bank President Barber Conable expressed concern trade protectionism at heart new showdown between United States Japan might spread throughout industrial world But interview Reuters Conable action by United States to slap tariffs on certain electronic goods Japan did mean countries were heading full scale trade war Conable World Bank been pressing developing countries to open their markets arguing free trading environment increased possibility global economic growth We fact been making adjustment loans to many countries developing world encouraged opening their markets we want to be sure developed world doesn t close at same time he He U S action against Japan a significant retaliatory step but did constitute basic change trade policy interview came just before next week s semi annual meetings Bank International Monetary Fund Referring to Brazil s recent interest payments moratorium Conable also global debt situation very serious must be closely watched He Bank past concentrated on making loans assist basic underpinnings developing world such as dams roads sewers increasingly make assistance available economic reform Bank increased these loans part because debt crisis found countries desperately need new funds balance payments adjustment economic reforms aimed at opening their markets encouraging foreign investment reducing government s role economy We re comfortable adjustment lending we expect however never reach majority our portfolio Conable He made clear however adjustment lending continue to increase as proportion overall Bank lending some time He noted the problem debt severe one many countries asking adjustment assistance because problem debt Conable former Republican Congressman New York chosen by President Reagan Bank position year He associate Treasury Secertary James Baker who launched U S strategy shoring up indebted nations October included call increased adjustment lending by World Bank Conable also he expected result major study Bank s organization to be completed next several weeks He decision to seek reorganization based part on fact Bank come under fire poorest countries doing enough to help richest countries because inefficiency reorganization considered major initiative by Conable being closely watched by agency s member countries as indication his management style priorities I want to be sure institution viewed by those who must support as soundly constituted so be permitted to grow Conable However he I don t believe there anything basically wrong institution I don t believe to any redefinition purpose He however apparent debt initiative proposed by Baker given Bank central role dealing debt crisis Conable added cooperation between Bank sister agency International Monetary Fund good he talked often IMF Managing Director Michel Camdessus on variety issues On personal level Conable he feel need to put his personal stamp on Bank noting I don t particular mission here except to be useful to institution to process development He added so I don t feel great calling to personalize institution On development needs sub Sahara Africa Conable Bank constantly reviewing new ways assisting region noting half recently agreed financing billion dlrs Bank s International Development Association earmarked Africa Leading industrial nations expected to consider new forms debt relief very poorest nations like those Sub Sahara during next week s meetings

text.title: U S JOBS DATA SAID TO RULE OUT FED TIGHTENING
text.author: By Kathleen Hays Reuters
text.body: A steep drop goods producing jobs detracted U S March non farm payroll employment makes unlikely Federal Reserve tighten monetary policy to defend dollar economists U S March non farm payroll employment rose less than gain to financial markets expected Manufacturing employment fell compared February s gain while March construction employment dropped after being unchanged February text.body: The Securities Exchange Commission reminded corporate raiders others tendering shares companies they must extend period their offers open if key conditions changed Specifically agency those making tender offers companies stock must extend offers if they decide to eliminate conditions requiring minimum number shares to be tendered order offers to be valid Tender offers typically include minimum share conditions As result purchaser be bound to buy shares were tendered if minimum level were reached interpretation current rules officials clarifies SEC s present position agency tender offer must be extended if minimum share condition waived even if purchaser reserved right to do so interpretation makes clear waiving minimum share condition material change tender offer under U S securities law SEC officials SEC already other specific material changes such as changes percentage securities being sought or price being offered made during course tender offer require day extension offer length extension aimed at giving shareholders adequate chance to assess revisions tender offer specified cases where minimum share conditions were waived SEC officials length extension such cases depend on facts circumstances surrounding each case but generally be between five days agency cited two recent tender offers waivers minimum share conditios were tried on day each offer denying shareholders chance to react to new information Officials declined to identify two offers If bidder makes material change near or at end offer to extend offer to permit adequate dissemination SEC Federal securities law requires all tender offers remain open at least business days

two billion dlr acquisition seven television stations year marks first network startup since when ABC now owned by Capital Cities ABC Inc CCB hit airwaves I think our goal more than anything else to provide alternative to three networks Fox president Jamie Kellner Fox s debut comes when earnings at two three networks under pressure network advertising dollars been growing slowly The barriers to attorney If they enough money they good chance making work Fox president Jamie Kellner company expects to lose to dlrs year on revenues dlrs He take three to five years to turn profit To succeed s seven stations close to affiliates Although show dropped recently ratings still captive young audience late night time slot analysts Sunday s prime time shows include situation comedy Married around U S to run shows networks some affiated stations To make sure viewers get chance to see programs company taking unprecedented step airing them three times course evening I believe if some their shows were on traditional networks be extremely high rated Mandel who added his firm signed up several million dlrs advertising shows But some question whether Fox really become fourth network Robert text.title: CANADA OIL INDUSTRY SET FOR RECOVERY ANALYSTS
text.author: By LARRY WELSH Reuters
text.body: Firmer crude oil prices government aid packages corporate spending cuts help Canada s oil industry recover year sharp downturn industry analysts They there be significant earnings gains compared to year s dismal results when oil prices dropped pct On Canada s stock exchanges energy shares soared to their highest levels since many issues trading at record highs This reflecting tremendous amount optimism on part investment community outlook industry future extremely attractive Peters Co Ltd oil analyst Wilf Gobert Financial statements Canada s major oil companies culminating Dome Petroleum Ltd s billion Canadian dlr loss reported week painted bleak picture year s results analysts But financial statements snap shot recording history stock market indication future Gobert commented Toronto Stock Exchange s oil gas index companies up to so far trading today at end Among Canada s largest oil companies class shares Imperial Oil Ltd IMO A pct owned by Exxon Corp XON trading at up week low Shell Canada Ltd pct owned by Royal Dutch Shell Group at up low during year Texaco Canada Inc TXC pct owned by Texaco Inc TX at up low Levesque Beaubien Inc oil analyst Robert Plexman forecasts operating profit Canada s largest oil gas companies rise pct to billion dlrs operating cash flow increase pct to billion dlrs based on average oil price year U S dlrs barrel However if prices hold U S dlrs barrel net operating income could show pct increase cash flow pct higher analyst Plexman Although difficult to forecast extent profit improvement year gain should be significant he added Those improvements follow sharp downturn when operating income ten companies dropped pct to billion dlrs operating cash flow fell pct to billion dlrs But one industry source doesn t think oil prices hold recent gains more government assistance needed Canadian Petroleum Association technical director Hans Maciej sees industry cash flow falling another pct after dipping pct year Maciej he sees crude oil supply outweighing demand doesn t believe recent OPEC production accord continue to support prices However several companies share optimistic industry outlook expressed by majority analysts Shell Canada Norcen Energy Resources Ltd forecast improved earnings their annual reports issued week assuming oil prices remain at or above levels The industry s outlook positive but robust Texaco Canada annual report While oil prices strengthened somewhat there good reason to believe general level sustainable continued volatility likely Texaco Canada added face short term uncertainty many companies pared spending plans year s lower levels deferring most frontier exploration work The industry becoming very selective investments very conservative cautious unexpected Canadian Petroleum Association s Maciej Federal Alberta goverment aid measures helped cushion industry downturn improving results most significant help came September when federal government lifted pct Petroleum Gas Revenue Tax PGRT months earlier then planned Analysts estimate tax relief save larger oil companies billion dlrs by end PGRT cut helped brake steep profit cash flow decline many oil companies prevented further exploration spending cuts analysts For number companies PGRT cut absolutely necessary to even maintain kind reduced investments were made otherwise reduction been considerably more Maciej

text.title: FEBRUARY FOMC VOTES UNCHANGED MONETARY POLICY
text.body: The Federal Open Market Committee at February meeting voted nine to one to maintain then existing degree reserve restraint minutes showed FOMC issued asymmetric inter meeting policy directive gave greater possibility to firmer rather than easier policy Committee set six to seven pct January through March annualized growth target M M no M goal At prior meeting mid December FOMC set seven pct target M M November through March February FOMC kept four to eight pct Federal funds rate reference range policy as other recent meetings At telephone conference on February committee members discussed possible implications decisions reached Paris U S intervention foreign exchange markets No conclusions were contained minutes inter meeting policy directive February FOMC somewhat greater reserve restraint or slightly lesser reserve restraint might be acceptable depending on behavior aggregates taking into account strength business expansion developments foreign exchange markets progress against inflation conditions domestic international credit markets February FOMC voted nine to one unchanged policy Thomas Melzer St Louis Federal Reserve Bank president favored some tightening reserve conditions He noted strong growth bank loans November through January firm federal funds rate prevailed despite extraordinary pace reserve growth He also cited recent declines dollar s value Finally looking ahead Melzer pointed out potential further rise inflationary expectations He believed prompt restraints might avert need more substantial tightening later Regarding inter meeting policy adjustments FOMC minutes showed the members generally felt policy implementation should be especially alert to potential need some firming reserve conditions view FOMC somewhat greater reserve restraint be warranted if monetary growth did slow line current expectations there were concurrent indications intensifying inflationary pressures against background stronger economic data One indication potential price pressure might be further tendency dollar to weaken minutes showed one member presumably Melzer preferred directive did contemplate any easing during weeks ahead However most members did want to rule out possibility some slight easing during inter meeting period although they did view conditions such move as likely to emerge FOMC members assumed future fluctuations dollar s value be sufficient magnitude to any significant effect on Fed s economic projections addition they anticipated considerable progress be made reducing federal budget deficit

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC DRUG COMPANIES NEW
reuters.text: DRUG COMPANIES NEW YORK Hyman said cosmetics used to be more appealing to drug companies but product lines have matured and competition became more fierce At one time the profit margins in these businesses were more attractive The businesses were small and had a lot of opportunity to grow she said Analysts said drugs while ultimately subject to patent expirations can be marketed for years without competition from generic products Cosmetics however are fad related and there are no barriers to competition Saks said pharmaceutical companies in the last two years have been selling non strategic assets among them the once alluring cosmetics businesses Pfizer Inc PFE and Schering Plough Corp SGP remain among the only two drug companies with cosmetics concerns Schering is committed to its Maybelline cosmetics unit We ve made a strategic determination as a company that cosmetics is a main line business for us and we want to develop it aggressively the spokesman said The spokesman would not comment on whether Schering would want to add by acquisition to that line Pfizer had no comment but analyst Ronald Nordmann of PaineWebber said he does not believe Pfizer would want to sell off its Coty business Analysts said Elizabeth Arden is one of the more attractive cosmetics concerns Hyman said the company s performance should be in line with the expectations for the U S industry She predicts the U S industry in will have unit growth of three pct and sales growth of six pct She estimated U S cosmetic sales to amount to about two billion dlrs annually Arden had operating profits of mln dlrs in on sales of mln dlrs Reuter

text.title: EC AGREES ON NEED TO STRENGTHEN EMS
text.author: By Tony Carritt Reuters
text.body: European Community EC finance ministers central bankers agreed on need greater cooperation to strengthen European Monetary System EMS against international market turbulence officials There general to reinforce European Monetary System all implies Belgian Finance Minister Mark Eyskens yesterday after hosting one day session informal talks at Belgian coastal resort gathering first such discussion since second major realignment EMS parities within nine months January system come under severe strain as funds flowed out slumping dollar into dominant EMS currency West German mark sending soaring against weaker currencies system But Eyskens February s agreement between leading western industrialised nations to stabilise exchange rates at around current levels working allow EC to speed up efforts to boost internal stability EMS He told news conference yesterday s meeting agreed on need closer coordination among EMS member governments interest rate policies interest rate differentials between different countries They also agreed they needed better coordination exchange market intervention to hold currencies stable both when they reached their fixed EMS limits within their agreed margins But Eyskens coordination raised whole range technical problems ministers discuss these further Luxembourg June on basis proposals EC s Monetary Committee Committee Central Bank Governors He EC needed set indicators economic convergence betwen Community countries important interest rates fulfilled role together exchange rates inflation rates Belgian minister whose country presently holds presidency community made clear meeting produced any agreement to move radically forward developing EMS towards EC s long term goal economic monetary integration We committed ourselves to reestablishing normal functioning system Eyskens Eyskens repeatedly stressed he believes EMS to be reinforced if EC s plans to liberalise all movements capital across national borders by to go ahead EC executive Commission President Jacques Delors told meeting authority put forward proposals final phase capital market liberalisation October include safeguard clauses member countries move create difficulties Eyskens ministers central bankers also discussed need to dedramatise realignments EMS parities by letting high ranking monetary officials carry them out by telephone rather than calling meeting finance ministers However West German sources Bonn Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg unenthusiastic idea British Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson told journalists one technical issues raised by greater coordination exchange market intervention question currencies should be used to intervene held central bank reserves He several EMS member countries believed EMS work better if central banks held each other s currencies issue particular importance regarding West Germany since Bundesbank holds only dollars foreign exchange reserves He debate on dedramatising EMS realignments reflected general feeling among participants way January reshuffle been conducted unsatisfactory realignment marked by acrimony between France West Germany each side blaming other strains system forced parity overhaul

text.title: JAL PLANE CRASH THOUGHT DUE TO BOEING BA N FAULT
text.author: By Janet Snyder Reuters
text.body: A Japanese government investigation team believes faulty repairs by Boeing Co caused worst single plane crash history one team Boeing Co manufacturer Japan Air Lines jumbo jet crashed into mountain Japan on August killing people There were only four survivors Boeing spokesman contacted by telephone at firm s headquarters Seattle Washington told Reuters firm probably no comment to make until Japanese investigation team s report officially released team investigator Japanese Transport Ministry official who declined to be identified failure by Japanese aircraft inspectors to check repair work done on plane by Boeing team provoked internal debate Ministry over inspection procedures Ministry official told Reuters report by his team already been sent draft form to U S National Transportation Safety Board comment should be released late May Under international convention draft must be submitted final comments to pertinent authorities Asked on Thursday Boeing s role crash Ministry spokesman declined comment On September Boeing issued official statement saying repairs undertaken on doomed Japan Air Lines plane were faulty However no official direct connection then made between faulty repairs crash Japanese investigation team says draft report believes those faulty repairs were cause accident investigator Boeing statement after crash Examination wreckage flight data recorder readout cockpit voice recorder interviews surviving off duty flight attendant indicate decompression occurred flight due to rupture aft pressure bulkhead The Boeing examination bulkhead at site crash revealed relatively small section bulkhead splice approximately per cent correctly assembled during repairs Boeing made after landing accident statement repairs were required after landing accident at Osaka airport western Japan plane s tail scraped runway Japanese report also mentions government inspectors who signed certificate airworthiness approving repairs he Police investigated four inspectors including one man who two weeks ago killed himself by drinking insecticide after four days police questioning None four looked at Boeing s repair work investigator

to continue showing modest gains dollar more room to fall Fed keep policy essentially steady perhaps several months Until trends clearer the market can only attempt to to establish hold new trading confidence environment until there illumination confidence U S Dollar trade policy Salomon Brothers Henry Kaufman bond market highly sensitized to dollar movements could be encouraged if currency markets seem to be stabilizing or if U S overseas economic growth perceived as slowing sharply The crucial question however how soon either these developments likely to occur Kaufman Market uncertainties erosion portfolio manager confidence could continue portfolio selling pressure while longer Philip Braverman chief economist at Irving Securities Corp However Braverman from longer term perspective current bond prices provide buying opportunity Despite nearly one point bond price rebound Friday on unexpectedly weak March employment data key year Treasury bonds lost points price week as whole Thursday s pct closing yield high Braverman historical evidence suggests long bond yield pct area provides basis optimism Bonds closed at pct on Friday Irving economist noted three times year similar paroxysm pessimism key bonds reached similar closing yield high Within three to six weeks each instance however Braverman bond prices recovered to bring yield down sharply by to basis points Mitchell Held Smith Barney Harris Upham Co Inc many portfolio managers now believe yields could approach nine pct by midyear he considers unlikely Held since late Smith Barney analysts spoken risk interest rates could move higher they continue to believe upward bias likely to persist over next few months Held conversations portfolio managers week there appeared to be increasing belief rate rise just begun yields could approach nine pct by midyear Naturally mean sharp bond price fall Yields could rise further over next few months but rise should be less than basis point rise we ve seen since start year Held Most expect Fed policy to be neutral bonds near term The Fed currently frozen into fixed stance economists at Aubrey G Lanston Co Inc They Fed cannot tighten policy push up interest rates as might be appropriate to stabilize dollar head off renewed inflationary psychology might harm fragile U S Economic expansion Lanston economists The Fed cannot ease policy stance to both foster more rapid economic growth calm domestic Third World debt jitters without threat causing further decline dollar Minutes February s Federal Open Market Committee FOMC meeting released Friday showed while FOMC left policy unchanged more inclined to firm rather than ease policy later if conditions economy foreign exchange or credit markets warranted policy shift However economists generally text.author: By Jennie Kantyka Reuters
text.body: Japanese oil traders generally expect oil prices to remain steady through June when next Organization Petroleum Exporting Countries Opec meeting scheduled to take place Prices kept to narrow trading range more than month despite coming under considerable pressure February as Japanese oil companies holding high oil stocks strongly resist paying official prices trade sources Despite these attempts spot crude rose steadily to stabilize around OPEC s dlr barrel target they Spot prices fell more than two dlrs during month mainly on market assumptions Opec producing more than barrel day bpd self imposed ceiling members submit to pressure to discount prices oil traders However Opec s discipline holding price output targets eventually forced many buyers back they Countries such as Qatar Iran Iraq refused to bend to demands lower prices spite threats non lifting Japanese buyers solidarity Opec encouraged Qatar to charter vessels to store production rather than cut prices they Opec s March production bpd below ceiling Saudi Arabia s output just below bpd compared to Opec quota bpd Middle East Economic Survey estimated Of course there little cheating but enough to destroy market oil trader Tokyo Opec crudes been appearing on spot market at discounted prices through barter deals swapping Middle East grades North Sea cargoes but these trades generated sufficient volume to depress market he current spot values Middle East grades only to cts below official prices so resistance to buying crude under term contracts second quarter likely to be weaker traders Indonesia s Minister Energy Mines Subroto today OPEC faces choice either maintaining present output volume at bpd seeing prices increase slightly or raising production ceiling so members can produce more third fourth quarters

text.title: JAPAN RULING PARTY SEEKS BIG SUPPLEMENTARY BUDGET
text.body: The ruling Liberal Democratic Party drawn up guidelines economic package including supplementary budget more than billion yen senior party official also urged government to concentrate first half current fiscal year began on April record proportion year s public works spending he LDP also suggested government review ceiling on budgetary requests investment public works projects presented by individual ministries he added But LDP official government should abandon fiscal reform target ending issue deficit covering bonds by fiscal These measures should be treated as emergency partly because urgent need Japan to redress external trade imbalance U S He guidelines be explained to U S week when Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa visits Washington International Monetary Fund IMF meeting he added official LDP Policy Affairs Research Council s Chairman Masayoshi Ito told press conference proposed supplementary budget probably be compiled no earlier than August but before November guideline be basis more detailed reflationary plan to be worked out by LDP before Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone leaves Washington on April talks President Reagan Ito full government endorsed economic package expected to be announced late May LDP expects public works spending first half to account more than pct what originally incorporated fiscal budget Ito previous record rate pct Ito revenue sources additional pump priming measures should include issue construction bonds use part proceeds sales privatized Nippon Telegraph Telephone Corp stocks LDP statement government should use additional budget mainly to encourage housing construction to revitalize regional economies hit hard by yen s rise

dealers dollar closed at yen against New York at close here yesterday dollar ended at marks against New York The market consensus G meeting unlikely to change present underlying bearish sentiment dollar likely just to reaffirm February Paris accord on currency stability manager at Japanese bank dollar decline seem to come to halt near yen after Tokyo closing on shortcovering as many operators just to reaffirm February Paris accord on currency stability manager at Japanese bank dollar decline seemed to halt near yen after Tokyo close on shortcovering as many operators seem unwilling to hold large positions ahead expected G meeting some dealers market closely watching probable meeting between U S Treasury Secretary James Baker Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa later today ahead G mainly on speculation ruling Conservative Party retain power expected general elections although Bank England may intervene market some dealers Bank Japan stepped into market soon after opening text.title: DOLLAR STARTS EASIER IN LONDON STERLING FIRM
text.body: The dollar opened easier after markets Far East sold down yen defeating new attempts by Bank Japan to check yen s rise through sustained currency intervention dealers But trading slow uninsipired although dollar sentiment remained bearish especially against yen dealers expected no major movements ahead tomorrow s Group Seven finance ministers meeting Sterling remained well bid as two new opinion polls showed ruling Conservative party increased strong lead increasing chances early election they dollar opened at yen compared at yesterday s European close closed at yen Tokyo after New York s dollar opened at marks after yesterday s close Europe closed at Tokyo after finishing at New York Sterling opened marginally weaker on trade weighted index dropping one basis point to But started firmer at dlrs against night also firmer against mark pound opened at marks against Europe night But lost some ground shortly after opening trading quietly around marks Dealers uncertainty still surrounding dollar yen mark sterling looks strong attractive on due to apparent surge support ruling Conservative party relatively high interest rates strong economy One opinion poll today showed Conservatives point lead over opposition Labour party point lead over Liberal Social Democratic Alliance Another forecast seat Conservative majority new parliament One dealer reported large sterling buying order Japanese institution earlier today But dealers were cautious to push sterling much higher amid wariness intervention by Bank England bank thought to intervened repeatedly yesterday but sighted market today dealers On dollar dealers all eyes were turned to Washington where finance ministers central bank governors Group Seven leading industrial nations meet tomorrow to review their February Paris currency stabilisation pact Few expect meeting to produce more than vaguely worded confirmation Paris goals currency stability increased economic cooperation outcome almost certainly lead to renewed dollar weakness especially against yen levels around yen well within reach some dealers But you never know Perhaps Japanese do come up some sort stimulation package satisfy market after all dealer U S Bank He noted news Japan working out reflationary supplementary budget senior official Japanese ruling Liberal Democratic Party earlier today party drawn up outline reflationary economic package including billion yen supplementary budget fiscal dollar opened at Swiss francs against Europe opened at French francs down European close

text.title: GERMAN BANK SUPERVISOR CALLS FOR WIDER REGULATION
text.body: West German banking regulations must be expanded to cover off balance sheet risks arising new financing forms Federal Banking Supervisory Office President Wolfgang Kuntze Kuntze told bankers at reception deals hedging price risks covered by current supervisory rules Such deals could be used speculation do to be disclosed Kuntze also must be considered whether banks can continue to set shareholders equity reserves against their own holdings securities Since early banks been limited to lending times shareholders equity reserves on consolidated basis Bundesbank officials interest rate currency swaps currency options under scrutiny Authorities favour reinterpreting banking law to fit present circumstances order to avoid long parliamentary political process changing banking sources Kuntze solutions to problem banking supervision can be found without having to change law again risk structure banking moving away model on banking supervisory rules based Kuntze Banking supervisors still firemen safety net but safety net become little too small he Kuntze declined to detail possible changes to banking regulations as these still subject discussions between Supervisory Office Bundesbank He he sees no chance foreseeable future international harmonisation supervisory law German supervisory office wait such harmonisation Nor get involved international competition on minimal regulatory standards order to shield banks competitive disadvantages he

reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC COCOA BUFFER STOCK MA

text.title: COCOA BUFFER STOCK MAY FACE UPHILL BATTLE TRADE
text.author: By Jane Merriman Reuters
text.body: The International Cocoa Organization ICCO buffer stock could face uphill battle to halt downtrend world cocoa prices when begins buying operations next few weeks cocoa traders Traders they believed buffer stock purchases could reach tonnes matter weeks without lifting prices significantly given amount surplus cocoa overhanging market buffer stock may begin buying shortly as ICCO day average indicator price now at Special Drawing Rights SDR per tonne below must buy level Rules governing buffer stock operations were agreed month by ICCO council Buying begin once buffer stock manager completed preparations traders Some traders buffer stock manager may delay buffer stock buying until mid or end April when changes months used to calculate ICCO indicator may lift day average above SDR must buy level ICCO indicator price calculated average second third fourth positions on London New York futures markets daily price SDR per tonne yesterday Months used currently indicator May July September but these set to change to July September December on April prior to May becoming New York spot month traders noted introduction December into calculations may lift daily SDR price as December currently quoted stg above May on London terminal market But buffer stock manager to wait higher daily price to feed through into day average indicator governs his activities traders The buffer stock manager obviously looking at implications delaying until forward prices lift indicator since might mean he to buy less cocoa analyst leading cocoa trade house Traders buffer stock purchases could reach tonnes fairly quickly once buying starts If purchases reach level within six months buying suspended pending ICCO council review price ranges But some cocoa market watchers buffer stock may benefit recent forecasts poor Brazilian Bahia temporao crop at to two kilo bags against initial expectations up to three lower than expected Brazilian crop may cut world surplus to between tonnes compared recent forecast by ICCO statistics committee tonnes traders these circumstances buffer stock may only need to buy between tonnes to lift prices above must buy level But some dealers ICCO buffer stock rules may put constraints on how quickly effectively buffer stock manager can remove cocoa market buffer stock system price differentials set according to quality pct limit on purchases non members could limit buffer stock s scope action dealers Most cocoa readily available to buffer stock nearby store material Malaysian Ivory Coast origin But buffer stock can only buy pct Malaysian cocoa as Malaysia ICCO member while purchases nearby cocoa can only reach pct any one day forces buffer stock to buy some intermediate forward shipment material Limits on buffer stock purchases nearby non member cocoa reduce impact on terminal prices pressured by overhang Malaysian material traders Buffer stock purchases forward shipment cocoa quality producers such as Ghana only limited impact on futures but likely to widen physical market premiums cocoa over futures Ghana s premium to terminal risen to stg to stg month ago partly anticipation buffer stock buying dealers The buffer stock may help terminal market but provide backstop quality cocoas one trader Traders cautioned views on impact buffer stock were all prognostication no one could hope to predict accurately what result be Psychologically buffer stock buying should help prices but since buffer stock already holds carryover tonnes previous cocoa agreement market surplus dealers expressed doubts purchases can counter bearish pressure June ICCO due to discuss rules withholding scheme as additional market support mechanism

text.body: The dollar steady near lower opening levels extremely quiet trading dealers did expect U S Currency to move significantly before series high level monetary meetings starting today Washington Sterling trading equally quiet Bullishness on back two new opinion polls suggesting Britain s ruling Conservative party increased lead over opposition checked by fears fresh sterling selling intervention by Bank England dealers dollar fetched marks at midsession against at opening Europe night dollar quoted at yen virtually unchanged opening but sharply below yesterday s European closing briefly dipped below yen to quoted low but recovered later to trade quietly around opening levels dealers Trade weighted sterling stood at pct value unchanged form opening but one basis point below yesterday s close pound fetched marks dlrs at midsession after opening yesterday s closing Dealers dollar business virtually halted Europe after large selloff against yen Far East sustained Bank Japan intervention failed to stem earlier today They absence other factors participants awaited outcome informal talks Group Five finance ministers central bankers Washington today Group Seven monetary talks tomorrow Most dealers expected meetings to produce little more than vaguely worded statement to reaffirm shared objectives stable currency markets economic policy coordination Group Five Canada agreed Paris on February to call halt to dollar s sharp decline several participant central banks since intervened to keep currencies within narrow ranges against each other But flare up long standing trade frictions between U S Japan month encouraged markets to test agreement pushing dollar sharply lower against yen Dealers short convincing undertaking by Japan at Washington talks to step up efforts to reduce trade surpluses stimulate domestic demand dollar resume fall especially against yen Without agreement on trade issue dollar appears set to test support levels at yen very short term yen within reach over next few weeks dealers Some dealers Japan appears ready to compromise U S On economic policy issues Expectations were rising further half point cut Japanese discount rate Japan s ruling Liberal Democratic Party today announced outline agreement on economic reflation includes billion yen additional budget dealers Some dealers market could get some impetus U S Federal Reserve chairman Paul Volcker when he testifies on Third World debt problems before Senate banking committee later today Dealers sterling remained firm amid growing confidence ruling Conservative party assured victory election they likely be called June One poll out today showed Conservatives leading pct support against Labour s pct Liberal Social Democratic Alliance at pct Another poll forecast Conserative majority seats new parliament But wariness Bank England sterling selling intervention made participants cautious pushing pound much higher dealers Some dealers Bank opening European close fetched French francs against at opening at close

reuters.unknown: A f reute h f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT FOREIGN BANKS IN GERMANY
text.author: By Allan Saunderson Reuters
text.body: Foreign banks West Germany reassessing their positions after number changes markets regulatory environment dampened once euphoric enthusiasm expansion here Banking sources most important changes were plans to bring securities holdings into capital lending ratios first such move major financial centre could place serious burden on several foreign banks particularly those active primary secondary bond markets Foreign banks much lower equity reserve capital than most domestic banks Senior banking sources talks between Bundesbank banking supervisory office over bringing securities primarily bonds under banking laws governing capital ratios were progress Although no date been set imposition banks as early as year may be obliged to bring bonds under rules limit bank lending to times shareholders equity reserves Although other national regulatory authorities known to be considering similar steps light growing securitisation debt previously balance sheet Germany tradition prudence may be first Brian Kissack president Foreign Banks Association told Reuters It s positive sign could cause certain people who West Germany to query whether as attractive to get now Larger banks may begin to use global networks to pass on holdings mark securities to other centres less stringent ratios taking business out country he added But sources foreign banks faced host other practical problems as well These included apparent unwillingness Bonn government to make early move to abolish stock exchange turnover tax signs London s Big Bang may deeper implications German securities trading than first thought difficulty finding experienced securities professionals to staff new subsidiaries growing pressure on commercial banking margins forcing widespread retrenchment refocusing activities threat having to face renewed push market share by largest most powerful Japanese banks By leaving stock exchange turnover tax out initial negotiating session incoming federal coalition government Bonn dashed hopes soon be abolished tax pct on each side securities trade by non bank but levied on public authority bonds extra cost particularly finely priced instruments such as floating rate notes kept much mark securities business firmly City awaiting change But aside London more active than domestic houses expected Large U S British Japanese Swiss investors often preferred to execute block trades shares up City market makers who could absorb at least some paper their own positions diminishing immediate impact on share price Most German brokers banks pass trades direct to exchange floor cutting profits or adding to costs Bank Liechstenstein Frankfurt GmbH board member Michael Zapf London s share German securities business done causing foreign banks without German units to weigh whether establishment costs involved were worth returns Additional signs London market makers may move into secondary level stocks added to concern he Now plans by many foreign banks to transfer mark securities trading entirely to newly established mainly Frankfurt based units were being reassessed sources continuing existence stock exchange tax also effectively prevented birth short term mark paper market certificates deposit or commercial paper Many U S Investment money centre banks particular were hoping experience these provide lever to prise open tight credit relationships between companies their domestic house banks At moment U S Investment banks expanding fastest here unit Salomon Inc SB N began summer Morgan Stanley Group Inc MS N currently fitting out offices probably summer start to business unit Manufacturers Hanover Trust Co should begin operations toward year end Merrill Lynch Co Inc MER N Shearson Lehman Brothers known to be weighing conversion current small operations to full standing units But expansion been hampered by lack experienced personnel hitherto fairly small market big three Swiss banks arrived between late first half been steadily building up securities departments taking staff equally domestic foreign competitors two U S Banks longest established here Citibank AG Chase Bank AG been particularly hard hit Both banks recently announced plans to cut back commercial activities shut down German branch offices on orders head office competitive environment return on assets employed insufficient to meet requirements sources But weakening attraction Financial Centre Germany unlikely to deter major Japanese banks setting up full subsidiaries when Bundesbank gives green light mark eurobond lead management probably around third quarter Once banks such as Dai Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd DIKB T Sumitomo Bank Ltd SUMI T move competition business staff even premises soar sources

text.title: U S AID CHIEF TO BE NAMED TO TOP TREASURY POST
text.body: President Reagan shortly nominate head U S program Third World development Peter McPherson as second ranking officer Department Treasury administration sources They White House expected to announce McPherson s nomination to succeed Richard Darman as deputy Treasury scretary later week nomination subject to Senate approval McPherson headed Agency International Development AID since As Treasury Secretary James Baker s chief assistant he be expected to work closely on international economic policy including major problems Mexican Brazilian debts McPherson lawyer worked White House under President Gerald Ford after serving as corporate tax specialist Internal Revenue Service He also spent two years Peru as member Peace Corps Darman who considered to played central role achieving agreements among industrial countries on international economic policy leave Treasury on April to join Investment Banking Group Shearson Lehman Brothers

text.body: The ruling Liberal Democratic Party drawn up guidelines economic package including supplementary budget more than billion yen senior party official official LDP Policy Affairs Research Council s Chairman Masayoshi Ito told press conference proposed supplementary budget probably be compiled no earlier than August but before November also urges government to concentrate first half current fiscal year began on April record proportion year s public works spending guidelines be explained to U S week when Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa visits Washington meetings IMF G ministers Ito added LDP suggested government review ceiling on budgetary requests investment public works projects presented by individual ministries Ito But LDP official government should abandon fiscal reform target ending issue deficit covering bonds by fiscal These measures should be treated as emergency partly because urgent need Japan to redress external trade imbalance U S He guideline be basis more detailed reflationary plan to be worked out by LDP before Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone leaves Washington on April talks President Reagan Ito full government endorsed economic package expected to be announced late May LDP expects public works spending first half to account more than pct what originally incorporated fiscal budget Ito previous record rate pct Ito revenue sources additional pump priming measures should include issue construction bonds use part proceeds sales privatized Nippon Telegraph Telephone Corp stocks LDP statement government should use additional budget mainly to encourage housing construction to revitalize regional economies hit hard by yen s rise

reuters.unknown: V f reute u f BC BRITAIN WARNS JAPAN O

text.title: BRITAIN WARNS JAPAN OVER TRADE ROW
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: British corporate affairs minister Michael Howard told Japan to resolve row over U K Firm Cable Wireless Plc s CAWL L shareholding new Japanese telecommunications company or face abrupt deterioration trade relations meetings both foreign telecommunications ministers Howard he expressed deep concern way Tokyo handled dispute continuing trade imbalance between two countries I put to post telecommunications minister I sure he did want to be responsible abrupt deterioration trading relations our countries widespread reverberations elsewhere world Howard told reporters He listened very carefully I little doubt message got home he added British frustration over lopsided trade balance nearly six billion dlrs Japan s favour year reached boiling point over telecommunications issue Howard Howard accused Japan trying to shut out Cable Wireless having major role international telephone market Japan I want fair crack whip Cable Wireless as I want fair crack whip Britain generally trading relations Howard We simply aren t prepared to continue to accept imbalance been position such long time Post Telecommunications Ministry officials were unable to comment on Howard s meeting their minister But Foreign Ministry officials Foreign Minister Tadashi Kuranari British exports to Japan increasing but acknowledged continuing imbalance trade Kuranari he wants everyone telecommunications dispute including Cable Wireless to be satisfied Howard told reporters Britain actively considering possible retaliatory measures if did get way on telecommunications issue There measures under consideration if we continue to suffer imbalance our trading relations he added but gave no details He he received reassuring response Japanese he spoken But course we ve reassuring signs Japanese quite some time he added What I ve made plain we expect to see action Howard ruled out using powers Britain s Financial Services bill to retaliate against unfair trade practices Those powers allow London to ban foreign financial firms like banks Britain designed to ensure U K Firms equal access to overseas financial markets

text.title: VW CURRENCY DEPARTMENT FORMER HEAD ARRESTED
text.body: The former chief foreign exchange at Volkswagen AG VOWG F been arrested connection scandal may cost car maker quarter billion dlrs chief state prosecutor Carl Hermann Retemeyer He told Reuters Burkhard Bobby Junger arrested yesterday suspected embezzlement There reason to believe Junger could evaded justice investigating magistrates therefore asked his arrest Retemeyer VW fired Junger March after news emerged suspected foreign exchange swindle January board gave him leave absence Six other people been suspended VW month computer programs were erased documents faked possible fraud believes transactions meant to protect against foreign currency losses were completed Retemeyer We still investigating larger circle people among them Frankfurt currency dealers He comment whether other arrests could be expected possible fraud resulted major management shake up resignation Rolf Selowsky management board member charge finance who assumed managerial responsibility affair Retemeyer month he wanted to question Frankfurt based money broker Joachim Schmidt who may be able to give more details

reuters.unknown: V RM f reute u f BC TREASURY S BAKER TO H

text.title: TREASURY S BAKER TO HOLD TALKS ON ECONOMIC GROWTH
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: U S Treasury Secretary James Baker holds talks counterparts Europe Japan today to urge them to carry out commitments recent accord to speed their economic growth Baker also expected to outline proposals making agreements to coordinate economic policies more binding bilateral discussions foreshadow full blown talks Group Five industrial countries joined later by Italy Canada to form Group Seven five comprise finance ministers central bankers United States Japan West Germany France Britain Treasury Secretary expected to see Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg British Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson Baker other finance ministers say they intend to reaffirm Paris Agreement to buttress global economic growth reduce trade imbalances stabilize currencies Monetary sources short communique to effect expected after meeting ends These talks form part week s semi annual meetings International Monetary Fund World Bank At same time monetary sources say they expect Baker to put forward proposals originally outlined at Tokyo Summit to tighten procedures policy coordination Washington wants other major nations to establish specific policy goals economic growth inflation current account balance payments trade balances budget performance monetary conditions currencies If actual economic performance veers sharply away such objectives then countries should consult on whether corrective action necessary proposal says Monetary sources there some support proposal may be made final until Venice Economic Summit June but Britain West Germany were firmly against any attempt to make corrective action automatic U S Treasury team led by Baker worked on plan since September when won support France Baker meanwhile press Japan West Germany to live up to their commitments made over six weeks ago Paris to boost their domestic demand to absorb more imports He also expected to reassure his counterparts Reagan administration reach agreement Congress on significant budget deficit cut year helping to depress U S demand imports aim Paris Accord to redress huge imbalance between trade surpluses Tokyo Bonn on one hand Washington s massive trade deficit on other Japan particular under pressure to come up meaningful stimulus package or face further rise yen Financial markets appear to believe yen should go higher against dollar development become unacceptable Japan Paris Agreement by United States Japan West Germany France Britain Canada called currencies to be stabilized around current levels But dollar fell again just several weeks after agreement reached present stability to be temporary as dealers await outcome week s talks Meanwhile representatives leading Third World countries continue preparing their position their ministers to present to industrial nations later week Monetary sources so called Group developing nations preparing very tough communique brands western strategy shoring up debt strategy as failure They call instead vast new assistance industrial world much greater role International Monetary Fund World Bank

text.body: Stock prices may climb higher today riding two day advance saw Dow Industrials climb points analysts But they cautioned market due pause after such strong climb could move into short term consolidation today as well Yesterday Dow Jones Industrial average closed above mark first time ever Special situations airlines strong bond market helped push average up points to end day at Gainers led losers by seven six on Big Board while volume slid slightly to shares shares Friday I think we ll get day be on balance positive but any record setter Thom Brown Butcher Singer Brown market needs pause before any stronger advance We need bit consolidation here he Eighty five points just too much too soon Brown added market probably pay much attention to February consumer credit number being released today The market s been ignoring fundamentals he I don t see any problems Blue Chips easing higher today Chris Callies Dean Witter But she market may some short term trouble area We re still midst correction broad market she It s entirely clear rally end two day correction began week newspapers Wall Street Journal s Heard on Street some people feel when Mesa Limited Partnership provided badly needed assets to NRM Energy exchange large stake company move may turned NRM into T Boone Pickens investment fund New York Times Market Place column first half hour trading becoming more important time when large amount important growing investment Japan Europe enters market Indeed column Salomon Brothers study shows pct market s total gain during first two half months year came first half hour trading

reuters.unknown: C G T f reute u f BC ACCU WEATHER HIGHLIGH
reuters.text: ACCU WEATHER HIGHLIGHTS APRIL The storm that battered the eastern portion of the United States over the weekend with heavy snow and flooding rains will continue weakening today Only lighter rains will linger from Pennsylvania through New England The drier weather will be welcome as many streams and rivers are near or over their banks especially in New England Significant rain has occurred the past two days in the coffee growing regions of Kenya Prior to Sunday very dry weather had been occurring in the central and eastern portions of the coffee areas However to inches and more rain occurred Sunday through Monday helping to erase the moisture deficits that had built up The western coffee regions also shared in the ample rains of the past couple of days but moisture supplies were already adequate Moisture supplies in most of the major wheat growing regions of the United States are currently adequate despite dry weather the past week However there are a couple of pockets where rain would be welcome The wheat regions of Washington State have been rather dry since the beginning of the year as less than pct of normal precipitation has been recorded Also the past few weeks have been extremely dry The wheat areas of Minnesota and eastern North Dakota could also use rain the next few weeks before spring planting begins Reuter

reuters.unknown: A f reute r f AM ITALY

text.title: ITALIAN GOVERNMENT EXPECTED TO FALL TOMORROW
text.body: Italy s government expected to fall tomorrow after majority Christian Democrats decided to withdraw their ministers unless Socialist Prime Minister Bettino Craxi resigned political sources today They decision brought prospect early general elections even closer After tense eight hour meeting Christian Democrat leadership late night registered the dissolution present government party provides more than half ministers Party leader Ciriaco De Mita told reporters when Craxi went to parliament confidence debate There won t be Craxi government any more I don t believe you can confidence vote government does exist Craxi announced today after being told Christian Democrat decision cabinet meeting be held tomorrow afternoon he then go to Senate upper house sources at cabinet meeting Christian Democrats senior partners coalition including Social Democrats Liberals Republicans as well as Socialists tell Craxi he to resign If he refused to do so insisted on full debate they withdraw their ministers forcing collapse government before confidence vote sources

Iran reported launching new offensive east Iraq s southern city Basra while Baghdad forces repulsed attack killing thousands Iranians BEIRUT Rescue workers planned to evacuate wounded Palestinian refugee settlements Beirut bid to relieve plight besieged community Palestinian sources CAIRO Egypt s opposition charged yesterday s general election rigged as early results showed President Hosni Mubarak s ruling National Democratic Party NDP heading big majority Parliament ZEEBRUGGE Belgium stricken British car ferry up to bodies could still be trapped rose slowly North Sea mammoth salvage operation off coast BUENOS AIRES Pope John Paul starting one week tour Argentina told politicians they should always defend human rights even difficult situations no government right to respond to violence violence TOKYO Japan s ruling Liberal Democratic Party outlined package economic measures under mounting protectionist pressure United States Meanwhile visiting British Corporate Affairs Minister Michael Howard told Japan to resolve telecommunications row his country or face abrupt deterioration trading relations MANILA Communist rebels they destroyed vital military communications station Northern Philippines army spokesman seven rebels were killed gun battle southern region BELFAST Mourners clashed police at Irish Republican Army IRA funeral Northern Ireland prisoners rioted high security jail guerrillas attacked security bases FREETOWN Sierra Leone Sierra Leone s former vice president Francis Minah sacked two weeks after failed coup been detained on suspicion involvement plot police sources BELGRADE Over Yugoslav firms almost workers heading bankruptcy trade union chief Newspapers quoted union leaders as saying recent strikes be aggravated when authorities force loss making companies to shut down BRUNSWICK West Germany former chief foreign exchange at Volkswagen been arrested connection scandal may cost carmaker millions dollars chief state prosecutor NEW DELHI reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC SPAIN S SOCIALISTS HO

text.title: SPAIN S SOCIALISTS HOLD OUT AGAINST STRIKERS
text.author: By Jules Stewart Reuters
text.body: Widespread strikes seriously disrupted Spain s economy wage restrictions likely to continue as policy makers call more austerity to help country compete European Community EC foreign bankers analysts The strikes were unexpected some cases spectacular but they little effect on basic economic life U S Banker told Reuters The socialists can apply restrictive measures as long as unions remain relatively weak communist led Workers Commissions recently rejected call by leadership general strike while ruling Socialist Party s trade union arm General Workers Union refused to demonstrate communists on May government s chief concern inflation stood at pct year high inflation rate especially damaging view Spain s trade balance Europe turned into deficit year after entry to EC Officials say situation rapidly deteriorating deficit dlrs first two months only slightly below dlr deficit all government tightened up money supply called maximum pct wage increases same as year s inflation target pursuing program industrial restructuring despite unemployment rate pct Bankers say tight money policies attracted avalanche foreign capital cashing on strong peseta high interest rates those funds converted into pesetas swelling money supply still further Bank Spain governor Mariano Rubio week money supply expected to rise pct first quarter compared year s eight pct target Most analysts agree government to accept inflation closer to six pct year but they say there little cause alarm The money supply should be back on track by summer we begin to see lower interest rates Andres Trujillo general manager Hong Kong Shanghai Banking Corp s Madrid branch He told Reuters labour protests despite occasional outbursts violence having serious impact on foreign investment Spain big relatively underdeveloped market he It still easier to compete here than other countries sporadic unrest likely to scare off investors Juan Jose Macaya general manager Investban SA portfolio management company he expects monetary objectives to be under control two or three months There been some nervousness stock exchange but we see as short term reaction he

text.title: RUDING AGAINST FURTHER DOLLAR FALL TRADE CURBS
text.body: Shifts domestic economic policy further fall dollar or trade restrictions key to reducing imbalances trade payments Dutch Finance Miniister H Onno Ruding Ruding told meeting World Trade Forum here protectionism naturally lead to retaliation aggravate problems heavily indebted developing countries The main contribution towards resolving still enourmous U S trade deficit repeat further fall dollar still more protectionism your country No like other countries changes domestic economic financial policies Ruding Ruding he less worried crisis weakening dollar than he January before Paris accord to stabilize foreign exchange rates He highest priority should be given to policy changes United States especially reducing budget deficit encouraging domestic savings But he other countries such as Japan West Germany also needed to take greater steps toward reducing their trade surpluses

text.body: Federal Reserve Board Chairman Paul Volcker further large drop value dollar could be counterproductive world economic growth Testifying before Senate Banking Committee Volcker Europe Japan were slowing exports growth those countries also decreasing In kind situation further sizeable depreciation dollar could well be counterproductive he Domestic expansion foreign industrial countries been enough to offset effects slower exports Volcker On value dollar Volcker he could say whether should be higher or lower to restore balance trade What we do know substantial exchange rate adjustment already been made he That adjustment should be large enough context growing world economy fiscal restraint United States to support widespread expectations narrowing real trade deficit period ahead he Volcker U S exports were now growing substantially while import growth should slow Volcker to improve trade deficit minimum inflationary pressure United States to slow spending growth also to achieve better balance between investment domestic savings if wants to be able to dispense foreign capital The constructive way to work needed direction be to reduce our budget deficit year by year paving way improvements our trade accounts he Relying on depreciation dollar alone risk renewed inflation he

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC U S CALLS FOR GREATE

text.title: U S CALLS FOR GREATER GATT CHECKS ON TRADE
text.body: The United States appealed stronger powers General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT to enforce world trade rules call by U S Deputy Trade Representative Michael Smith at special committee meeting into future GATT follows series bilateral trade rows clouded efforts by nation body to promote fair trade Today s meeting part Uruguay trade round launched by ministers September round covers areas trade agriculture manufactured goods services take four years to negotiate Smith called boosting GATT s links financial institutions such as International Monetary Fund World Bank He also urged greater involvement trade ministers to ensure success Uruguay Round The GATT as institution needs to be strengthened to assure GATT plays proper role management world trading system global economy Smith Rules can be ignored if institution weak or perceived as unable to adapt to changing world economy He also also urged member states be accountable to each other their trade policies Smith who flies to Brussels today talks European Community EC officials told Reuters committee wanted to stress GATT s importance did discuss specifics We interested more periodic ministerial involvement Whether formal or informal meetings he GATT s ruling council due to hear complaint nation EC on April U S Japanese accord on semiconductors EC charges accord breached GATT trade rules by allowing Tokyo to set minimum prices Japanese chips sold third countries requesting GATT dispute panel be set up to review agreement President Reagan who strongly supported Uruguay trade round to promote freer trade Washington impose tariffs against Japanese electronic goods He Tokyo shown willingness to open markets to U S Exports

text.body: Bundesbank council member Lothar Mueller bank given up money supply policy restraining money supply growth does always mean pushing up interest rates Mueller article Boersen Zeitung financial daily monetary policy took into account exchange rate expectations capital flows could be confused exchange rate oriented policy article followed international press speculation Bundesbank abandoned money supply targetting favour exchange rate policy Mueller member Bundesbank council his position as president regional state central bank Bavaria noted Bundesbank s decision January to cut leading interest rates amid continuing strong monetary growth led some people to think dropping monetary targetting Simply to ignore external economic context be risky dangerous monetary policy he explained Mueller cuts official interest rates put end to interest rate speculation Bundesbank could now assume upward pressure on mark ease currency inflows slow down Lower money market rates achieved by widening short long term interest rate differentials also encouraged investors to re invest funds parked liquid accounts Mueller measures therefore aimed clearly at bringing monetary growth back onto desired path he Finally course there no need to keep quiet cut interest rates also line changed economic situation few months he added All all Bundesbank no way abandoned money supply policy January discount rate cut despite suppositions to contrary Mueller Keeping money supply developments check always synonymous raising interest rates especially when excessive liquidity due to inflows abroad rather than growth bank credits cause rising monetary holdings non banks Mueller Now West Germany no longer ran large external deficits other concepts were needed monetary policy Mueller be both difficult dangerous monetary policy to pursue specific mark dollar exchange rate any case exchange rate partly depends on U S Currency budgetary policy U S Economy he But exchange rate orientation also mean end strict stability policy because both interest rates liquidity be affected by required currency intervention could no longer be steered autonomously by Bundesbank Even interest rates centre Bundesbank s considerations but reflect competition other market conditions Mueller cut bank liquidity directly influence central bank money stock Bundesbank s main money supply indicator does reflect banking liquidity but liquidity industry households cannot be directly reached Bundesbank s instruments Mueller less dependent non banks on bank credits harder to steer money supply increasingly been case recently because non banks received considerable sums current account surpluses capital imports If Bundesbank tried to brake money supply rise higher interest rates as been appropriate if credit growing excessively only missed target but probably even set off further inflows he Mueller growth money supply still too high three months money stock grew at annual rate seven pct down pct previous quarter growth curve therefore come closer to three to six pct target corridor central bank money stock growth pointing to success current policy he But high monetary stocks can be warning sign there should be no change priorities Monetary policy must be first foremost stability policy successful stability policy money supply policy nothing else he

text.body: Kuwait asked at least four countries including United States Soviet Union Britain China temporary use their flags or tankers to protect Kuwaiti oil shipments troubled Persian Gulf Reagan Administration officials officials confirmed New York Times report Kuwait wants to transfer some oil tankers to U S or Soviet registration hopes Iran be reluctant to launch new Silkworm missiles at superpower flags United States vowed to keep gulf open to international oil traffic warned Tehran against using Chinese made missiles recently installed Iran near mouth gulf They the Kuwaitis also asked Britain China possibly some other European countries to lease tankers to carry their oil one administration officials who asked to be identified told Reuters United States considering request to temporarily transfer Kuwaiti ships to American registration but such move could create insurance other problems officials U S defense officials told Reuters yesterday Kuwait decided at least time being to accept U S offer to use American warships to escort tankers gulf where both Iran Iraq been attacking shipping

reuters.unknown: RM F f reute u f BC EQUITIES DRIFT LOWER

text.title: EQUITIES DRIFT LOWER ON EASIER WALL STREET OPENING
text.body: Equities drifted lower after easier opening on Wall Street but London market depressed outset on lack interest feeling yesterday s gains were overdone dealers Much today s business inter professional but dealers noted despite today s falls low volume market still firm although cautious undertone At GMT FTSE index down points at compared opening Concern over possibility trade war Japan although less pronounced provided further caution Yesterday Japanese finance ministry made moves to try dispel fears trade war by saying help to expand Tokyo Stock Exchange membership to facilitate foreign membership However British corporate affairs minister Michael Howard told Japan to resolve row over Cable Wireless shareholding new Japanese telecommunications company or face abrupt deterioration trade relations Cable Wireless been at centre trade row up p at latest media opinion polls helped to underpin prices as they strengthened belief ruling Tory party win next U K General election Although there still uncertainty over timing election most dealers polled by Reuters afternoon thought June be most likely time poll conducted breakfast television programme TV AM showed Conservatives points ahead Opposition Labour Party while poll Times newspaper measured party support key marginal seats gave Tories lead six points over labour opposition Market leader ICI stood unchanged at but IC Gas slipped p to on profit taking after yesterday s stong gain while Jaguar rose p to mainly on U S demand ahead motor show New York Pharmaceuticals Wellcome down p to on further text.title: LONDON MONEY MARKET CLOSES LITTLE CHANGED
text.body: Money market interest rates closed little changed after quiet session as yesterday s talk lower U K Base lending rates fizzled out dealers Further opinion polls showing ruling Conservative Party well ahead little effect on market operators looking more definite news on political front Sterling continued quietly steady ahead Group Seven talks Washington week One senior money broker commented What we want election date to put stop to all speculation Once market knows what s happening then we can move forward next move U K Base rates now stand at pct still expected to be down but uncertainty over date general election making cautious trading dealers Yesterday opinion polls showing Government set to retain substantial working majority lifted sterling fuelled speculation lower U K Interest rates British authorities likely to remain cautious however as G finance ministers meeting set to review their February Paris accord on currency stability could affect sterling today just one basis point lower trade weighted terms to stand at Dealers noted longer dated paper again dominated day to day dealings between discount houses Bank England As rates fell yesterday no band four
